symptoms: Joint pain, Swelling, Stiffness (especially in the morning), Fatigue, Weakness, Fever, Loss of appetite, Rheumatoid nodules (lumps under the skin)
description: Autoimmune disorder causing inflammation of joints and surrounding tissues
medicines: Nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs), Disease-modifying antirheumatic drugs (DMARDs), Biologic response modifiers (e.g., TNF inhibitors)

symptoms: Joint pain and swelling, Butterfly-shaped rash on face (malar rash), Fatigue, Fever, Chest pain, Sensitivity to sunlight, Mouth or nose sores, Raynaud's phenomenon
description: Chronic autoimmune disease affecting various organs and tissues
medicines: Nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs), Corticosteroids, Antimalarial drugs, Immunosuppressants, Biologic therapies

symptoms: Fatigue, Numbness or weakness in limbs, Blurred or double vision, Tingling or pain in parts of the body, Impaired coordination or balance, Cognitive changes
description: Autoimmune disease affecting the central nervous system
medicines: Corticosteroids (for acute exacerbations), Disease-modifying therapies (Interferons, Glatiramer acetate)

symptoms: Increased thirst, Frequent urination, Extreme hunger, Unintended weight loss, Fatigue, Irritability, Blurred vision
description: Autoimmune condition causing destruction of insulin-producing cells in pancreas
medicines: Insulin therapy (multiple types), Blood sugar monitoring, Oral medications (in some cases)

symptoms: Fatigue, Weight gain, Cold intolerance, Dry skin and hair, Constipation, Muscle weakness, Joint pain, Heavy or irregular periods (in women)
description: Autoimmune disorder leading to inflammation and underactivity of the thyroid gland
medicines: Thyroid hormone replacement therapy (Levothyroxine), Anti-inflammatory medications (for symptom relief)

symptoms: Hyperthyroidism symptoms: Weight loss, Rapid heartbeat, Nervousness or irritability, Tremors, Sweating, Fatigue, Heat intolerance, Bulging eyes (exophthalmos)
description: Autoimmune disorder causing overactivity of the thyroid gland
medicines: Antithyroid medications (Methimazole, Propylthiouracil), Beta-blockers (for symptom relief)

symptoms: Diarrhea, Abdominal pain and cramping, Rectal bleeding, Weight loss, Fatigue, Reduced appetite, Fever, Perianal complications (fistulas, abscesses)
description: Chronic inflammatory bowel disease affecting the gastrointestinal tract

symptoms: Diarrhea (often bloody), Abdominal pain and cramping, Rectal bleeding, Urgency to defecate, Inability to defecate despite urgency, Fatigue, Weight loss
description: Chronic inflammatory bowel disease affecting the colon and rectum

symptoms: Red patches of skin covered with silvery scales, Itching or burning, Thickened or ridged nails, Swollen or stiff joints (psoriatic arthritis), Plaques on scalp
description: Chronic autoimmune condition affecting the skin
medicines: Topical corticosteroids, Vitamin D analogs, Retinoids, Biologic therapies

symptoms: Abdominal pain, Diarrhea, Bloating, Gas, Fatigue, Weight loss, Anemia, Osteoporosis, Dermatitis herpetiformis (skin rash)
description: Autoimmune disorder triggered by gluten ingestion, causing damage to the small intestine
medicines: Gluten-free diet (strict avoidance of gluten-containing foods), Nutritional supplements

symptoms: Lump in breast or armpit, Change in breast size or shape, Nipple changes (inversion, discharge), Skin changes (redness, dimpling), Breast pain, Swollen lymph nodes
description: Cancer that forms in the tissues of the breast
medicines: Chemotherapy, Hormonal therapy (Tamoxifen, Aromatase inhibitors), Targeted therapy (Herceptin), Radiation therapy

symptoms: Persistent cough, Chest pain, Hoarseness, Shortness of breath, Coughing up blood, Fatigue, Unintended weight loss, Recurrent respiratory infections
description: Cancer that begins in the lungs
medicines: Chemotherapy, Immunotherapy (Checkpoint inhibitors), Targeted therapy (EGFR inhibitors), Radiation therapy, Surgery

symptoms: Urinary problems (frequent urination, weak urine stream), Blood in urine or semen, Erectile dysfunction, Pain or stiffness in pelvis, Bone pain
description: Cancer that occurs in the prostate gland
medicines: Active surveillance (for low-risk cases), Surgery (Prostatectomy), Radiation therapy, Hormonal therapy (Androgen deprivation therapy)

symptoms: Change in bowel habits (diarrhea or constipation), Blood in stool, Abdominal discomfort or pain, Fatigue, Unintended weight loss, Anemia
description: Cancer that starts in the colon or rectum
medicines: Surgery (Colectomy, Proctectomy), Chemotherapy, Targeted therapy (EGFR inhibitors), Immunotherapy (Checkpoint inhibitors), Radiation therapy

symptoms: Change in size, shape, or color of a mole, New mole or growth on skin, Itching or pain in a mole, Sores that don't heal, Spread of pigment from border of a mole
description: Cancer that develops in the melanocytes (pigment-producing cells)
medicines: Surgery (Wide local excision), Immunotherapy (Checkpoint inhibitors), Targeted therapy (BRAF inhibitors), Radiation therapy

symptoms: Fatigue, Weakness, Pale skin, Frequent infections, Fever, Easy bleeding or bruising, Enlarged lymph nodes or spleen, Bone pain
description: Cancer of the blood-forming tissues
medicines: Chemotherapy, Targeted therapy (Tyrosine kinase inhibitors), Immunotherapy (Monoclonal antibodies), Stem cell transplant

symptoms: Swollen lymph nodes (usually painless), Fatigue, Fever, Night sweats, Unintended weight loss, Itchy skin, Respiratory symptoms
description: Cancer of the lymphatic system
medicines: Chemotherapy, Immunotherapy (Checkpoint inhibitors), Targeted therapy (Monoclonal antibodies), Radiation therapy

symptoms: Abdominal bloating or swelling, Pelvic pain or pressure, Difficulty eating or feeling full quickly, Urinary urgency or frequency, Fatigue, Back pain
description: Cancer that begins in the ovaries
medicines: Surgery (Hysterectomy), Chemotherapy, Targeted therapy (PARP inhibitors), Immunotherapy (Checkpoint inhibitors)

symptoms: Abdominal pain or discomfort, Jaundice (yellowing of skin and eyes), Unintended weight loss, Loss of appetite, Nausea, Fatigue, New-onset diabetes
description: Cancer that starts in the pancreas
medicines: Surgery (Pancreatectomy), Chemotherapy, Targeted therapy (EGFR inhibitors), Immunotherapy (Checkpoint inhibitors), Radiation therapy

symptoms: Headaches, Seizures, Nausea and vomiting, Cognitive changes (memory loss, difficulty concentrating), Weakness or paralysis, Vision or speech problems
description: Cancer that occurs in the brain
medicines: Surgery (Tumor resection), Chemotherapy, Radiation therapy, Tumor-treating fields therapy (Optune)

symptoms: Blood in urine, Painful or frequent urination, Back or pelvic pain, Urinary urgency, Unintended weight loss, Fatigue, Bone pain
description: Cancer that begins in the bladder
medicines: Surgery (Transurethral resection, Cystectomy), Immunotherapy (Checkpoint inhibitors), Chemotherapy, Radiation therapy

symptoms: Jaundice, Abdominal pain or swelling, Unintended weight loss, Loss of appetite, Fatigue, Weakness, Nausea and vomiting, White chalky stools
description: Cancer that starts in the liver
medicines: Surgery (Hepatectomy), Liver transplant, Ablation therapy, Embolization, Chemotherapy, Targeted therapy (Sorafenib)

symptoms: Difficulty swallowing (dysphagia), Pain or discomfort in chest or throat, Unintended weight loss, Chronic cough, Hoarseness, Heartburn
description: Cancer that forms in the esophagus
medicines: Surgery (Esophagectomy), Chemotherapy, Radiation therapy, Immunotherapy (Checkpoint inhibitors), Targeted therapy (EGFR inhibitors)

symptoms: Chest pain (angina), Shortness of breath, Fatigue, Weakness, Dizziness, Nausea
description: Narrowing or blockage of coronary arteries, leading to reduced blood flow to the heart muscle
medicines: Aspirin, Statins, Beta-blockers, ACE inhibitors, Calcium channel blockers

symptoms: Chest pain or discomfort (often radiating to arm, jaw, back, or neck), Shortness of breath, Nausea, Vomiting, Sweating
description: Death of heart muscle tissue due to blocked blood flow to the heart
medicines: Aspirin, Thrombolytics, Beta-blockers, ACE inhibitors, Statins

symptoms: Shortness of breath (especially during physical exertion or when lying flat), Fatigue, Swelling (edema) in legs, ankles, or abdomen, Rapid or irregular heartbeat
description: Inability of the heart to pump blood effectively
medicines: Diuretics, ACE inhibitors, Beta-blockers, Aldosterone antagonists, Angiotensin receptor blockers

symptoms: Headaches, Shortness of breath, Nosebleeds, Flushing, Dizziness, Chest pain (in severe cases)
description: Persistent elevation of blood pressure above normal levels
medicines: Diuretics, ACE inhibitors, Angiotensin II receptor blockers, Calcium channel blockers, Beta-blockers

symptoms: Palpitations (fluttering or pounding sensation in chest), Chest discomfort, Shortness of breath, Dizziness, Fainting (syncope)
description: Irregular heart rhythm or heartbeat
medicines: Antiarrhythmic medications, Beta-blockers, Calcium channel blockers, Anticoagulants

symptoms: Painful cramping in hip, thigh, or calf muscles after physical activity (claudication), Numbness or weakness in affected limb, Coldness in lower leg or foot
description: Narrowing or blockage of arteries supplying blood to extremities
medicines: Antiplatelet agents (e.g., Aspirin), Statins, Medications to control blood pressure

symptoms: Chest pain (angina), Shortness of breath, Weakness, Fatigue, Numbness or weakness in limbs, Confusion, Vision problems
description: Buildup of plaque (fatty deposits) in arteries
medicines: Statins, Antiplatelet agents (e.g., Aspirin), Beta-blockers, ACE inhibitors, Calcium channel blockers

symptoms: Shortness of breath, Fatigue, Swelling in legs, ankles, or abdomen, Irregular heartbeats, Dizziness or lightheadedness, Chest pain or pressure
description: Disease of the heart muscle, leading to weakened heart function
medicines: ACE inhibitors, Beta-blockers, Diuretics, Anticoagulants, Antiarrhythmic medications

symptoms: Irregular heartbeats (palpitations), Rapid heartbeat (tachycardia), Weakness, Fatigue, Shortness of breath, Chest pain or discomfort
description: Irregular and often rapid heartbeat originating in the atria
medicines: Anticoagulants, Rate control medications (Beta-blockers, Calcium channel blockers), Rhythm control medications (Amiodarone, Flecainide)

symptoms: Shortness of breath, Fatigue, Irregular heartbeat, Swelling in legs or abdomen, Chest pain or pressure, Dizziness or fainting episodes
description: Dysfunction or damage to heart valves, affecting blood flow
medicines: Diuretics, ACE inhibitors, Beta-blockers, Anticoagulants, Heart valve repair or replacement surgery

symptoms: Fever, Chills, Fatigue, Weakness, Shortness of breath, Chest pain, Palpitations, Small red or purple spots on skin (petechiae)
description: Inflammation of the inner lining of the heart chambers and valves

symptoms: Chest pain (sharp, stabbing, or dull), Shortness of breath, Cough, Fever, Fatigue, Swelling in abdomen or legs, Irregular heartbeat
description: Inflammation of the pericardium (the sac surrounding the heart)

symptoms: Cyanosis (bluish tint to skin, lips, or nails), Shortness of breath, Poor feeding or growth (in infants), Fatigue, Swelling in extremities
description: Structural heart defects present at birth
medicines: Surgical repair, Medications to control symptoms (e.g., Diuretics, ACE inhibitors)

symptoms: Fatigue, Chest pain, Shortness of breath, Palpitations, Swollen or tender joints, Fever, Skin rash
description: Heart damage caused by rheumatic fever, resulting from untreated strep throat
medicines: Antibiotics (to treat strep throat), Anti-inflammatory medications, Surgery (in severe cases)

symptoms: Persistent cough with thick sputum, Wheezing, Shortness of breath, Recurrent lung infections (pneumonia), Poor growth or weight gain
description: Genetic disorder causing thick, sticky mucus buildup in lungs and other organs
medicines: Airway clearance techniques (Chest physiotherapy, Percussion and vibration), Bronchodilators, Inhaled antibiotics, Mucolytics, Enzyme supplements

symptoms: Involuntary jerking or writhing movements (chorea), Muscle problems (rigidity, slow movements), Cognitive decline, Behavioral changes, Difficulty swallowing
description: Inherited disorder causing progressive degeneration of nerve cells in the brain

symptoms: Intellectual disability, Low muscle tone (hypotonia), Upward slanting eyes with small folds of skin at inner corners (epicanthal folds), Flat facial profile
description: Genetic disorder causing developmental and intellectual delays
medicines: Early intervention programs, Educational support, Speech therapy, Occupational therapy

symptoms: Progressive muscle weakness, Difficulty walking, Frequent falls, Gait abnormalities, Enlarged calves, Muscle contractures, Heart problems, Breathing difficulties
description: Progressive muscle-wasting disease caused by genetic mutation
medicines: Corticosteroids (Prednisone, Deflazacort), Physical therapy, Mobility aids, Respiratory support

symptoms: Excessive bleeding from minor injuries or surgery, Easy bruising, Joint pain or swelling (hemarthrosis), Blood in urine or stool, Nosebleeds
description: Genetic disorder impairing blood clotting ability
medicines: Clotting factor replacement therapy, Desmopressin (DDAVP), Antifibrinolytic medications

symptoms: Pain crises (sudden and severe pain), Anemia, Fatigue, Jaundice, Swelling of hands and feet (dactylitis), Frequent infections, Delayed growth and development
description: Genetic disorder causing abnormal hemoglobin production and red blood cell shape

symptoms: Developmental delay, Loss of motor skills, Seizures, Blindness, Deafness, Difficulty swallowing, Progressive intellectual disability
description: Genetic disorder leading to progressive destruction of nerve cells in the brain
medicines: Supportive care (Symptom management), Physical therapy, Occupational therapy

symptoms: Kidney problems (renal Fanconi syndrome), Growth failure, Muscle weakness, Photophobia (sensitivity to light), Poor appetite, Vomiting, Delayed puberty

symptoms: Intellectual disability, Developmental delays, Behavioral problems, Hyperactivity, Seizures, Skin rashes, Musty odor in urine, Eczema
description: Inherited disorder causing inability to metabolize phenylalanine
